verbose_text: The marine Synechococcus sp. strains WH8101 and WH7805 have both been found to produce siderophores for scavenging iron from nutrient depleted environments, whilst Cu complexing ligands are produced to mitigate the toxic effects of copper, with cyanobacteria particularly sensitive to this metal.
evidence: Cu-complexing ligands are produced to mitigate the toxic effects of copper
